review: Very fast and smooth! I'm coming from an older Roku 2 XD (which has served me very well over the years) but the Fire TV is a huge step up in performance. Great picture quality and a nice user interface.I really only have a two complaints. The first is the way Amazon organizes and presents the Prime video content. Under the "watchlist" tab there is no way to separate your movies from TV shows, its just all jumbled together. Even the app on my old Roku broke up the movies and TV shows into separate lists or had the option to view the "watchlist" all together. Maybe there is a way to do this but i just haven't discovered it yet. The second issue I have come across is the the Hulu app. I have a Hulu Plus account and noticed that a maximum of 8 shows will show up in my queue at one time. If more than 8 shows are added they just don't appear in the queue. I also have a Kindle Fire HDX and the Hulu Plus app works well and has no issues displaying more than 8 shows in the queue. I contacted Amazon and Hulu about the issue, they both confirmed that it was a problem affecting the Fire TV only and not the Kindle Fire but no timeline on a fix.Other than those two issues I'm very happy with purchase and would recommend it to others. If anyone else has had the same issue with Hulu or no issues at all I would like to hear about it, maybe its something specific with my player.
author: Amazon Customer "marinehrnt"
